channel.title: New Core i7 Build
channel.description:
Intel Core i7 2700k @ 3.6GHz Corsair Dominator 16GB 1600Mhz Ram Corsair H70 Water Cooler Corsair 650 Watt Modular Power Supply Corsair 90GB SSD Asus nVidia GTX 570 1.25GB Asus Maximus IV Gene-Z Western Digital 500GB Caviar Black Cooler Master Excalibur 120mm Case Fans on Radiator NZXT Individual Sleeved Cables Lite-On Bluray Drive/Burner
Thoughts?

item.title: New Core i7 Build
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:23, topic:427544”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=530241.msg3874522#msg3874522 date=1325563948]

I understand the idea of the bottom-mounted PSU, it just doesn’t look right to me yet. Though as Greeny mentioned, my first computer was horizontal with the monitor sitting on top, and it took me awhile to get used to vertical standing cases.

Though, now that you mention it, why is it better that the mobo, CPU, and RAM sit at the top and get all of the heat rather than the PSU? I’d think the cheaper part would be better able to withstand the heat.
[/quote]Air flow goes through case from the front to the back, the advantage is that you don’t get any heat buildup near the PSU.

The heat buildup is still there though right? Just closer to the CPU/RAM than the PSU when their positions are switched.[/quote]

a good exhaust fan eliminates any heat buildup around the cpu area, my heatsink is blowing air to the standard 120mm rear exhaust and I literally get 30c temp air blowing out of my top 140mm fan

Read full topic

item.title: New Core i7 Build
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:23, topic:427544”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=530241.msg3874522#msg3874522 date=1325563948]

I understand the idea of the bottom-mounted PSU, it just doesn’t look right to me yet. Though as Greeny mentioned, my first computer was horizontal with the monitor sitting on top, and it took me awhile to get used to vertical standing cases.

Though, now that you mention it, why is it better that the mobo, CPU, and RAM sit at the top and get all of the heat rather than the PSU? I’d think the cheaper part would be better able to withstand the heat.
[/quote]Air flow goes through case from the front to the back, the advantage is that you don’t get any heat buildup near the PSU.

The heat buildup is still there though right? Just closer to the CPU/RAM than the PSU when their positions are switched.[/quote]

Heat rises, so if you have a top mounted PSU it can result in a build up of heat around the PSU. If you have nothing on the top of the case, you can have all heat generated just exhaust out of the top.

Read full topic

item.title: New Core i7 Build
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:23, topic:427544”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=530241.msg3874522#msg3874522 date=1325563948]

I understand the idea of the bottom-mounted PSU, it just doesn’t look right to me yet. Though as Greeny mentioned, my first computer was horizontal with the monitor sitting on top, and it took me awhile to get used to vertical standing cases.

Though, now that you mention it, why is it better that the mobo, CPU, and RAM sit at the top and get all of the heat rather than the PSU? I’d think the cheaper part would be better able to withstand the heat.
[/quote]Air flow goes through case from the front to the back, the advantage is that you don’t get any heat buildup near the PSU.

The heat buildup is still there though right? Just closer to the CPU/RAM than the PSU when their positions are switched.[/quote]The PSU intakes from the bottom of the case and exhausts through the back of the power supply. I’ve never felt mine get hot anyway, maybe warm while gaming.

Read full topic

item.title: New Core i7 Build
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Bottom PSU cases just look so, wrong…

As someone who sees both I don’t see why!? I’ll tell you what looks weird (and rare!)- People who still have their towers horizontal with their monitor on top!

Read full topic

item.title: New Core i7 Build
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Bottom PSU cases just look so, wrong…

How so? Its a much better design as Niall pointed out because its much more stable, if someone where to bump the case the weight is at the bottom. Its also a better cooling design (warm air rises, cold air falls) not only is it pulling air through a easily removable filter on the bottom of the case, the air from there is cooler not only because its closer to the floor but because if it were mounted at the top of case it would be intaking all the heat from the video card and memory, and in case of a non water cooled cpu, the cpu heat. Moving the psu to the bottom also allows more space for exhaust fans at the top of the case. Not to mention I think aesthetically it looks better.

Read full topic

item.title: New Core i7 Build
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

t4:

only 650W psu?

I’m not overclocking or anything so I didnt feel like I needed to go any bigger I have used 3 of those corsair 650’s so I knew they were reliable power supplies

Read full topic

item.title: New Core i7 Build
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Bottom PSU cases just look so, wrong…

Most good cases are bottom mounted, and if the PSU isn’t shit, its better in that place too. The last 3 of my cases have been bottom mounted and it’s weird for me to even think that it wasn’t all that long ago that we thought putting them at the top of the case was normal, it seems ridiculous now.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

tL:

That is a very nice build, Corsair seem to design the inside of their cases very well. Nice and tidy, did you braid/sleeve the cables yourself?

Thankfully I didnt otherwise it would have been a pain, but they werent cheap though either nearly $10 a cable

http://www.amazon.com/s/ref=a9_sc_1?rh=i%3Aaps%2Ck%3Aindividually+sleeved+cables&keywords=individually+sleeved+cables&ie=UTF8&qid=1325437246#/ref=sr_pg_1?rh=i%3Aaps%2Ck%3Aindividually+sleeved+cables&keywords=individually+sleeved+cables&ie=UTF8&qid=1325437267
